subhead: The French prime minister justifies the €44 billion in budgetary efforts he is demanding for 2026 by citing the worrying state of public finances. But is the situation really that dire?

How Argentina fell in love with a poetic live stream from the ocean: 'Patrick Star is Argentinian!'
subhead: By filming the depths of the South Atlantic this summer, a scientific mission sparked unprecedented enthusiasm. The project brought much-needed attention to public research, which has been left struggling after budget cuts by President Milei.

headline: Venus Williams wins a US Open women's doubles match for the first time since 2014 – and without Serena
subhead: Tennis star Venus Williams, 45, was playing doubles at a major for the first time since the 2022 US Open, her sister Serena Williams' final tournament. On Thursday, Venus partnered with Leylah Fernandez to defeat the sixth-seeded pair of Lyudmyla Kichenok and Ellen Perez 7-6 (4), 6-3.

headline: In Kyiv, Oleksandr Glyadelov's images defy the bombs
subhead: For 35 years, the Ukrainian photographer has documented the history of his country. Starting September 5, the Ukrainian House in Kyiv will present a major retrospective of his work. The exhibition pays tribute to the spirit of national resistance.

headline: PSG's Ousmane Dembélé: 'The Ballon d'Or is the Holy Grail'
subhead: The Paris Saint-Germain forward is considered a top contender for the prestigious award recognizing the best football player of the season. Speaking to Le Monde, the Frenchman emphasized his club's collective performance over his individual achievements.

The twilight of Morocco's King Mohammed VI
subhead: 'The Enigma of Mohammed VI' (1/6). Twenty-six years after his 1999 coronation, the Moroccan monarch's relationship to power remains complex. As questions about his health arise, the prospect of his succession is fueling power struggles and backroom deals among the country's elite.

headline: Mohammed VI, the makhzen and the art of palace secrecy
subhead: 'The Enigma of Mohammed VI' (5/6). In order to maintain his power, the Moroccan monarch relies on a handful of loyal supporters, most of whom he has known for decades. However, internal rivalries betray a certain nervousness, revealing the uncertainty surrounding the future of his reign.

headline: At the Venice Film Festival, French filmmakers take on literary adaptation
subhead: Valérie Donzelli, François Ozon, Cédric Jimenez and Olivier Assayas are all presenting films adapted from novels at the Mostra, running from August 27 to September 6.
